{"step_by_step_thinking": "The National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) was launched by the Indian government to address the health needs of under-served rural areas. According to the documents, the NRHM has appointed Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHAs) to serve in rural areas (Document 25). The NRHM also aims to strengthen institutional delivery under the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) (Document 29). The NRHM has also established health and family welfare societies (Document 0). However, there is no mention in the documents of the NRHM establishing a state and district health mission.", "answer_choice": "D"}
